match.title: 4th ODI
match.statusText: Bangladesh won by 6 wickets (with 229 balls remaining)

image.caption: An overview of the Zohur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium
image.longCaption: An overview of the Zohur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium, Bangladesh A v England, March 7, 2010

match.hoursInfo: 09.30 start, First Session 09.30-13.00, Interval 13.00-13.45, Second Session 13.45-17.15

dismissalText.long: c Nazmul Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller c Nazmul Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan 13 (36b 2x4 0x6 60m) SR: 36.11

dismissalComment.html: sensational catch by Nazmul, that's the seventh wicket down, length ball outside off, the batsman drives it towards cover point where Nazmul throws himself full length to his right and takes a blinder, he was parallel to the ground as he took that one

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Ashraful b Enamul Haque jnr
dismissalText.commentary: Stuart Matsikenyeri c Mohammad Ashraful b Enamul Haque jnr 11 (30b 1x4 0x6 32m) SR: 36.66

dismissalComment.html: gets a wicket with a not too threatening delivery, short and turns away, should have been put away for a boundary, instead Matsikenyeri can only slap it to backward point, where the fielder takes a smart catch diving to his left

sensational catch by Nazmul, that's the seventh wicket down, length ball outside off, the batsman drives it towards cover point where Nazmul throws himself full length to his right and takes a blinder, he was parallel to the ground as he took that one

image.caption: Ray Price
image.longCaption: Ray Price portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalComment.html: nine down! fuller length delivery, fired in bit quicker this time, Price pushes forward to defend but fails to get bat on ball and the ball crashes into his toe. The angle would have take the ball towards the stumps. Not much appeal there but umpire Nadir Sha is convinced.

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's the end of that! tossed up on the middle and off stump line, Jarvis get forward and pushes it straight back to the bowler. Shakib holds on to an easy chance and Zimbabwe are all out for 44 in 24.5 overs

gets a wicket with a not too threatening delivery, short and turns away, should have been put away for a boundary, instead Matsikenyeri can only slap it to backward point, where the fielder takes a smart catch diving to his left
arm ball does the job, Zimbabwe slip further into the abyss, the batsman was looking for the turn as he defended, this one didn't spin and sneaked through the big gap between bat and pad

oh dear! tossed up and on the stumps, Chigumbura pushes forward and drives it in the air and back towards the bowler, Enamul Haque moves across to his left, dives low and takes a superb catch. Zimbabwe 8 down - just two more to go

headshotImage.caption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Ashraful b Nazmul Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza c Mohammad Ashraful b Nazmul Hossain 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: first blood! short of a good length delivery, came in with the angle, Masakadza looks to go over the top of mid-on but fails to get enough bat on it and the ball lobs up straight to Ashraful at mid-on. Nazmul strikes in the first over

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor c & b Abdur Razzak 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: gone! tossed up close to the off stump line, Taylor pushes forward and drives at it and the ball goes straight back to the bowler who makes no mistake. Zimbabwe two down in two overs. Excellent start for Bangladesh

dismissalText.commentary: Charles Coventry c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Nazmul Hossain 1 (6b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 16.66

dismissalComment.html: another one bites the dust! short of a good length delivery and this one shaped away a touch, Coventry stays back and has a prod at it, ball clips the outside edge and goes straight to the keeper. Zimbabwe three down and in deep deep trouble here

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mark Vermeulen lbw b Abdur Razzak 3 (9b 0x4 0x6 27m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Razzaq strikes this time, another innocuous straight delivery, Vermeulen plays outside the line this time, is struck on the pad in front of off, that's the end of his stay

dismissalComment.html: oh dear! tossed up and on the stumps, Chigumbura pushes forward and drives it in the air and back towards the bowler, Enamul Haque moves across to his left, dives low and takes a superb catch. Zimbabwe 8 down - just two more to go

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Cremer b Price 22 (26b 3x4 0x6 27m) SR: 84.61

dismissalComment.html: flat delivery on the middle and off stump line, Tamim goes low and sweep but fails to keep it down. Cremer at square leg drives across to his right and takes a low catch. Umpire Aleem Dar has a word with the fielder before he gives the nod

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the one that goes straight on with the arm - Ashraful is clueless and the ball thuds in to the pad. Loud appeal and up goes the finger. Ashraful departs for a duck.

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: goodness me! wide delivery outside the off stump, Siddique stretches across and needlessly pushes at it, ball clips the outside edge and goes straight to Vermeulen at first slip.

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Naeem departs! tossed up on the middle and leg stump line, the one that goes straight on - Naeem goes for the slog sweep and the finds the lone fielder in the deep on the leg side. That was a horrible shot to say the least - Bangladesh four down but they need just 7 more to win this one.

dismissalComment.html: Naeem departs! tossed up on the middle and leg stump line, the one that goes straight on - Naeem goes for the slog sweep and the finds the lone fielder in the deep on the leg side. That was a horrible shot to say the least - Bangladesh four down but they need just 7 more to win this one.

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot
off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: all over! tossed up on the leg stump line, Raqibul gets his front leg out of the way and slogs it over the wide long-on fence.

commentPostTextItems.html: The game lasted just 36.4 overs! 45 was always going to be tough to defend, Bangladesh did struggle a bit with the Zimbabwean spinners too getting good purchase from the track but in the end it was a comfortable win.
Another 50 runs could have made it into an even contest but that was not to be. Bangladesh now have an unassailable 3-1 lead with just one more game to go in the series.

Masakadza - "Misread the wicket today, it was slower than we thought". "We did give wickets away, which is something we have been doing throughout the series". "It is really disappointing that we are 3-1 down after going one up in the series". "It was good to come out and take four wickets but..."

Shakib Al Hasan - "We would have loved to win by 10 wickets but it was spinning a lot". When we started playing, we thought it was a flat track but when our spinners came in it was doing a bit and they landed the ball in the right areas". "We have been dropping some catches, we need to work a bit on our fielding."

Nazmul Hossain has been awarded the man-of-the-match for his splendid bowling effort (2 for 10 in 6 overs) and the excellent catch he took at point. That's all we have for you today, do join us on Thursday for the 5th and final game of the series. Good bye and good luck.

commentTextItems.html: defended off the back-foot
looks to work this one away on the leg side but fails to make contact and the ball rolls away off the pad. Half a shout for lbw turned down
on the middle and off stump line, hint of turn there -  Raqibul gets right behind the line and defends it with a straight bat
flat and full - driven back to the bowler.
turned away off the pads to the midwicket region, easy single

headshotImage.caption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Ray Price
image.longCaption: Ray Price portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

commentTextItems.html: flat delivery, pitched close to the off stump line and turning away late, Raqibul pushes forward to defend and is beaten
pitched up outside the off stump and Raqibul drives it past the fielder at cover, two more added to the total
defended on the front-foot
nudged away behind square on the leg side, no room for a single there
short delivery, Raqibul looks to work it away fine but the shot is not time well enough
wide delivery outside the off stump, no shot offered

commentPostTextItems.html: Bangladesh require another 5 runs with 6 wickets and 40.0 overs remaining

headshotImage.caption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Ray Price
image.longCaption: Ray Price portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

commentTextItems.html: fuller length delivery outside the off stump, Rahim picks up the length quickly and drives through the line and gets it into the gap between mid-off and cover. Welcome runs for Bangladesh
worked away on the leg side, diving stop at short midwicket cuts off the single
beaten outside the off stump, again big turn there
turned away off the pads to the short fine leg reigon

dismissalText.commentary: Naeem Islam c Chibhabha b Cremer 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: Naeem departs! tossed up on the middle and leg stump line, the one that goes straight on - Naeem goes for the slog sweep and the finds the lone fielder in the deep on the leg side. That was a horrible shot to say the least - Bangladesh four down but they need just 7 more to win this one.

commentPostTextItems.html: Chibhabha was placed at deep midwicket and the ball went straight to him and was taken leaning forward.

commentTextItems.html: on the pads, defended down on the leg side. End of a fine over

commentTextItems.html: quicker delivery, pitched close to the off stump line and this one turned late - Raqibul pushes forward to defend and is beaten comprehensively

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Ashraful b Nazmul Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza c Mohammad Ashraful b Nazmul Hossain 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: first blood! short of a good length delivery, came in with the angle, Masakadza looks to go over the top of mid-on but fails to get enough bat on it and the ball lobs up straight to Ashraful at mid-on. Nazmul strikes in the first over

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor c & b Abdur Razzak 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: gone! tossed up close to the off stump line, Taylor pushes forward and drives at it and the ball goes straight back to the bowler who makes no mistake. Zimbabwe two down in two overs. Excellent start for Bangladesh

headshotImage.caption: Charles Coventry player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Charles Coventry player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Charles Coventry player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Charles Coventry player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Charles Coventry c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Nazmul Hossain 1 (6b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 16.66

dismissalComment.html: another one bites the dust! short of a good length delivery and this one shaped away a touch, Coventry stays back and has a prod at it, ball clips the outside edge and goes straight to the keeper. Zimbabwe three down and in deep deep trouble here

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mark Vermeulen lbw b Abdur Razzak 3 (9b 0x4 0x6 27m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Razzaq strikes this time, another innocuous straight delivery, Vermeulen plays outside the line this time, is struck on the pad in front of off, that's the end of his stay

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Ashraful b Enamul Haque jnr
dismissalText.commentary: Stuart Matsikenyeri c Mohammad Ashraful b Enamul Haque jnr 11 (30b 1x4 0x6 32m) SR: 36.66

dismissalComment.html: gets a wicket with a not too threatening delivery, short and turns away, should have been put away for a boundary, instead Matsikenyeri can only slap it to backward point, where the fielder takes a smart catch diving to his left

dismissalText.commentary: Chamu Chibhabha b Enamul Haque jnr 0 (6b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: arm ball does the job, Zimbabwe slip further into the abyss, the batsman was looking for the turn as he defended, this one didn't spin and sneaked through the big gap between bat and pad

headshotImage.caption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Nazmul Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller c Nazmul Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan 13 (36b 2x4 0x6 60m) SR: 36.11

dismissalComment.html: sensational catch by Nazmul, that's the seventh wicket down, length ball outside off, the batsman drives it towards cover point where Nazmul throws himself full length to his right and takes a blinder, he was parallel to the ground as he took that one

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura c & b Enamul Haque jnr 4 (11b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 36.36

dismissalComment.html: oh dear! tossed up and on the stumps, Chigumbura pushes forward and drives it in the air and back towards the bowler, Enamul Haque moves across to his left, dives low and takes a superb catch. Zimbabwe 8 down - just two more to go

image.caption: Ray Price
image.longCaption: Ray Price portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

image.caption: Ray Price
image.longCaption: Ray Price portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Ray Price lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: nine down! fuller length delivery, fired in bit quicker this time, Price pushes forward to defend but fails to get bat on ball and the ball crashes into his toe. The angle would have take the ball towards the stumps. Not much appeal there but umpire Nadir Sha is convinced.

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Jarvis c & b Shakib Al Hasan 0 (17b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: that's the end of that! tossed up on the middle and off stump line, Jarvis get forward and pushes it straight back to the bowler. Shakib holds on to an easy chance and Zimbabwe are all out for 44 in 24.5 overs

image.caption: Ray Price
image.longCaption: Ray Price portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Cremer b Price 22 (26b 3x4 0x6 27m) SR: 84.61

dismissalComment.html: flat delivery on the middle and off stump line, Tamim goes low and sweep but fails to keep it down. Cremer at square leg drives across to his right and takes a low catch. Umpire Aleem Dar has a word with the fielder before he gives the nod

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Zunaed Siddique c Vermeulen b Cremer 8 (19b 1x4 0x6 34m) SR: 42.1

dismissalComment.html: goodness me! wide delivery outside the off stump, Siddique stretches across and needlessly pushes at it, ball clips the outside edge and goes straight to Vermeulen at first slip.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Ray Price
image.longCaption: Ray Price portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Ashraful lbw b Price 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: the one that goes straight on with the arm - Ashraful is clueless and the ball thuds in to the pad. Loud appeal and up goes the finger. Ashraful departs for a duck.

headshotImage.caption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Raqibul Hasan not out 9 (17b 0x4 1x6 20m) SR: 52.94

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Naeem Islam c Chibhabha b Cremer 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Naeem departs! tossed up on the middle and leg stump line, the one that goes straight on - Naeem goes for the slog sweep and the finds the lone fielder in the deep on the leg side. That was a horrible shot to say the least - Bangladesh four down but they need just 7 more to win this one.

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim not out 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 40

notes: Innings Break: Zimbabwe - 44/10 in 24.5 overs (AG Cremer 7)

milestones.description: This is the lowest match aggregate (93) involving teams Zimbabwe & Bangladesh in ODIs

stories.title: Bangladesh's most comprehensive win
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Chittagong
stories.summary: Stats highlights from Bangladesh's emphatic win in Chittagong

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan catches Kyle Jarvis
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan catches Kyle Jarvis, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Chittagong, November 3, 2009

stories.title: 'We definitely misread the pitch' - Masakadza
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Chittagong
stories.summary: Zimbabwe captain Hamilton Masakadza has admitted he misjudged the conditions after his side were shot for 44 on electing to bat in the fourth ODI against Bangladesh in Chittagong

image.caption: Nazmul Hossain with his Man-of-the-Match award
image.longCaption: Nazmul Hossain with his Man-of-the-Match award, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Chittagong, November 3, 2009

stories.title: Zimbabwe fold for 44 to surrender series
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Zimbabwe fold for 44 to surrender series
stories.summary: After the home side's bowlers demolished Zimbabwe for 44, the fifth lowest total in one-dayers, even a familiar failure at the top couldn't stop Bangladesh from taking the series by knocking off the runs in 11.5 overs

image.caption: Abdur Razzak continued to have a series to remember
image.longCaption: Abdur Razzak continued to have a series to remember, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Chittagong, November 3, 2009

stories.title: Pressure on Zimbabwe to stay afloat

stories.seoTitle: Pressure on Zimbabwe to stay afloat in ODI series
